meanings.sent1: The quiet music solemnifies the atmosphere in the church.
meanings.sent2: The judge's stern expression solemnifies the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: The clown's attempt to solemnify the party with a fake mustache made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds solemnify the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's salute solemnifies his dedication to duty.

meanings.definition: To give a serious or formal appearance to
meanings.sent1: Her black dress solemnifies the occasion.
meanings.sent2: The gold frame solemnifies the portrait hanging on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The oversized bow tie solemnifies his otherwise casual outfit.
meanings.sent4: The grand chandelier solemnifies the ballroom.
meanings.sent5: The official seal solemnifies the document.

meanings.definition: To mark with a solemn ceremony or observance
meanings.sent1: The wreath solemnifies the memorial service.
meanings.sent2: The flag solemnifies the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The ringing of the bell solemnifies the beginning of the event.
meanings.sent4: The lighting of the candles solemnifies the evening.
meanings.sent5: The traditional dance solemnifies the cultural celebration.
